comments.body:
NotFoundError: tensorflow/core/lib/bmp/testdata/lena.bmp
	 [[Node: ReadFile = ReadFile[_device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/cpu:0"](ReadFile/filename)]]


It looks like you need to add this file as testdata in the BUILD rule.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@  def testBmp(self):
    # Read a real bmp and verify shape
    path = os.path.join(prefix_path, "bmp", "testdata", "lena.bmp")
    with self.test_session(use_gpu=True) as sess:
      bmp0 = io_ops.read_file(path)

comments.body:
I grabbed this from the GIF tests in python/ops/image_ops_test.py. The [test image](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/lib/gif/testdata/scan.gif) is a multi-framed image of a white bar travelling across a black background. It looks like this test starts with an all-black (zeros) array and then fills in the appropriate pixels with white (255) depending on which frame it is and then checks to make sure that the read pixels match.

I can comment an explanation in or remove this check if you want.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +53,57 @@          start -= WIDTH
          end -= WIDTH
          gt[start:end, :, :] = 255

        self.assertAllClose(frame, gt)
